attributes.action: ban the use of animals in circuses in the UK
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Tonight (february 27th 2009) three elephants will perform in a circus for the first time in over a decade in a giant step-back for animal rights in the UK.  Sign this petition to campaign against the use of animals in circuses and to demand a change in current laws to make the use of these poor creatures illegal.

See also the RPSCA campaign: http://www.rspca.org.uk/servlet/Satellite?pagename=RSPCA/RSPCARedirect&pg=circuses 

"The RSPCA does not believe that wild animals' needs can ever be met in circuses and that confinement, constant transportation, abnormal social groups and inadequate winter quarters all cause suffering."

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
